definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: If you are unaware of the identity of "Lady Stoneheart, " read on at your own risk.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不知道石心夫人是谁，你可能会被剧透。

sentences.english: People hate spoilers, especially when they reveal the endings of a whodunnit.
sentences.chinese: 人们讨厌剧透，尤其是侦探悬疑小说的结局。

sentences.english: DiMartino: I don’t want to give anything away, but rest assured there’s a definite link between the old series and this one.
sentences.chinese: 我不想剧透诶，不过新老剧之间肯定有一定联系的。

sentences.english: But subjects enjoyed the spoiled version more than the original.
sentences.chinese: 但相比起原版，实验对象更喜欢含有剧透的版本。

sentences.english: You can experience the latest grave-robbing&horror television fiction of 2015 in advance.
sentences.chinese: 提前体验，剧透2015最新最火盗墓恐怖影视小说。

definition: painted eggshell/Easter egg/(media) Easter egg (hidden feature in software or a movie etc)/post-credits scene
The End (appearing at the end of a movie etc)
impression or feeling after visiting or watching (movies, museums etc)
see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
the boring part of something (film, show, etc.) where a bathroom break can be taken

(slang) Something awesome is about to happen! (originally, in a Japanese space battleship anime, it meant "Danger! High energy up ahead!" — a warning to either prepare for battle or take evasive action)
news from behind the scenes/stage gossip
to quit watching a TV series
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
editor or creator of online content (diminutive term, often used to refer to oneself: I, me, this writer)
